lines.text: [first lines]
Oh, hello.
Good evening, Sir. The valet's ill, so I'll be taking over.
And Sir, if you do go out this evening, may I respectfully recommend that you be careful?
Oh, I can take care of myself, I guess.
You're in a strange place, Sir. And if I may say so without givin' offense, you do seem an innocent sort of a gentleman.

[after a failed break-in]
No good, Governor. You'll find half a dozen of them patent bolts. Bright feller invented them ought to be jailed.
Say, are you a burglar?

[sarcastically]
Who, me? No.
Here Governor, what's your game, eh?
Oh, we're just looking around.
Huh?
You see, he's an American and he's always longed to see the roofs of London.
Ain't they got any roofs in the United States?
Well, uh, very different. Um, wigwams, you know.
[last lines]
There's only one worries me now.
What?
You think you're going to like America?

[singing]
Oh, I wish I had someone to love me. Someone to call me their own.
